definition[0]: used to talk about most members of a group, most occasions, most parts of something etc
example[0]: Green teas are mostly from China or Japan.
example[1]: There were about fifteen people in the lounge, mostly women.
example[2]: He blamed his parents. Mostly he blamed his dad.
explanation[0]: In written English, people often prefer to use generally or for the most part rather than mostly, because they sound more formal:
example[3]: Many tourists visit the region, generally for skiing.
example[4]: The inhabitants of the village are for the most part elderly.
